description:
As a Program Manager, you will join a team shaping the developer experience for games on Stadia. In this role, you will work with designers, engineers, producers, and executives from the world’s top game studios to support the quality assurance and localization of video games on Stadia.

Google's mission is to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful. Our Hardware team researches, designs, and develops new technologies and hardware to make our user's interaction with computing faster, more powerful, and seamless. Whether finding new ways to capture and sense the world around us, advancing form factors, or improving interaction methods, our Hardware team is making people's lives better through technology.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Experience in video game production.
  • Experience with localization and quality assurance across projects and/or games.
  • Experience in development and operations with AAA projects.
  • Experience in project management.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 7 years of experience in project management and working with cross-functional teams.
  • Experience in vendor management.
  • Experience managing complex projects with stakeholders across multiple functions.
  • Ability to learn new systems and tools and drive or design improvements..
  • Ability to take initiative and build effective and productive relationships.
  • Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills.
responsibilities:
• Create and manage a localization pipeline across multiple game titles.
  • Build and manage a quality assurance leadership team and contract teams to test numerous game titles throughout development.
  • Track milestones and progress across the entire portfolio of game projects.
  • Develop process and documentation to improve game development processes across all projects.
title: Program Manager, Localization and Quality Assurance, Stadia
